SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

org.zkoss.cdi.event
Annotation Type Events

@Qualifier
@Documented
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=PARAMETER)
@Inherited
public @interface Events

Used as method parameter annotation along with @Observes The value indicates observed event in the form of target component and event name for eg. for a onClick event of a button component with id myButton Events annotation can be used in following manner 


    public void sayHello(@Observes @Events("myButton.onClick") MouseEvent evt) {
      ...
     }

Multiple events can also be specified by separating them using comma for example


     public void sayHello(@Observes @Events("myButton.onClick,myButton1.onClick") MouseEvent evt) {
       ...
    }

Author:
ashish
See Also:
Observes

Required Element Summary
 java.lang.String value
          Event specified in the form of component id followed by a dot (.) followed by event name.
 

Element Detail

value

public abstract java.lang.String value
Event specified in the form of component id followed by a dot (.) followed by event name. Multiple events can be separated by comma
